title: Metallothionein polymorphisms and trace elements in Slovenian mother-child pairs (CROME-LIFE+ and HEALS study)

author: Anja Stajnko, Department of Environmental Sciences, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: So hello to everybody so.
So in our.

Research we are interested in the status of trace elements, essential and non essential in human population, but their concentrations measured in blood, urine and also other samples could be influenced but by various factors and one of these are variations in normal Physiology or the presence of some kind of disease.
Also, if individuals are exposed to environmentally or occupationally to those trace elements that we are measuring.
And one important factor is also lifestyle of individuals.

On the other hand, also very important factor is individual genetic variations, which is also the focus of my PhD, especially if these variations are in genes that are related to metabolism of trace elements, and my focus is actually the variations of single nucleotides in jeans which are coding for proteins.
Called metallothioneins.

Those are metal binding proteins that have several physiological roles and one of them is homeostasis and detoxification of trace elements and also very important role is that they are important for cellular oxidative stress protection.
They can be presented by different eyes of sub forms which are coded by by at least.
11 functional genes.
And in order to study genetic variations in these genes, we isolated and we will isolated DNA from blood, saliva and court issue from different populations.
And for current statistical analyzes that I did I focused on one.
Population.
Which consists out of 179 model pairs.
Mother child pairs in which we isolated DNA and determined the single nucleotide variations.
12 different ones in kniphfer and mythology on engines.
Then we try to find the associations between those genotypes that we determined with the.
Trace elements that were measured in urine and blood.
And we actually did found some statistically significant associations.
But in order to know what these associations means, and so for the interpretation of the results, some further work is needed.
So we have to check also this in different populations.
So that's.
All from my part.
